name: groovy

name: babel
description: we target Node 12 runtime because that is supported by AWS Lambda. Babel is the defacto solution for transpiling JS

name: python
description: python used for infrastructure tasks and some scripting

name: NodeJS
description: version 12 needed for AWS, but babel can transpile between versions

description: version 8 of java

description: version 11 of java

description: Spring Boot is preferred now

name: AWS SSM
description: instead of SSH

name: AWS Batch
description: Looking to see what other batch jobs can use this

name: Gigya
description: Gigya has had very poor performance and its JS SDK is blocked by ad trackers

name: mocha
description: mocha was the defacto tool of choice for JS but has been superceded by Jest

name: Packer
description: packer allows us to build machine images that need little or no further setup reducing the start up time for new servers

name: Puppet
description: puppet used to be used to run on live servers in production. we shouldn't be changing prod in this way. it also meant it took a long time for servers to start meaning that our ability to scale was lower

name: gulp
description: gulp was the defacto build tool for JS and was used in a number of applications but shouldn't be used in any new applications
